      • minimizeCostFunc

        private int minimizeCostFunc(int k)
        Minimizes costFunc
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block (starting with 0 in the upper left corner of the image).
        Returns:
        the index of the vector with the lowest costs out of the 14 alternatives.

      • costFunc

        private double costFunc(int k,
                        int altIndex)
        Calculates the cost for one block
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block (starting with 0 in the upper left corner of the image).
        altIndex - the index of the current alternative vector.
        Returns:
        the calculated cost.

      • dataTerm

        private double dataTerm(int k,
                        int altIndex)
        Calculates the data term of the cost function
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block (starting with 0 in the upper left corner of the image).
        altIndex - the index of the current alternative vector.
        Returns:
        the calculated value of the data term.

      • tempCoherence

        private double tempCoherence(int k,
                             int altIndex)
        Calculates the temporal coherence function
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block (starting with 0 in the upper left corner of the image).
        altIndex - the index of the current alternative vector.
        Returns:
        the calculated temporal coherence value.

      • spatialCoherence

        private double spatialCoherence(int k,
                                int altIndex)
        Calculates the spatial coherence/local energy
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block
        altIndex - the index of the alternative vector
        Returns:
        value of calculated spatial coherence/local energy

      • getAlternatives

        private java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D> getAlternatives(int k)
        Determines the alternative vectors according to the paper by T. Aach and D. Kunz. Inner blocks will have 14 alternatives. Bordering blocks will have less alternatives depending on their location.
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the alternative vectors

      • checkNeighbourIndices

        private int[] checkNeighbourIndices(int k)
        Determines the indices in order to iterate over neighbouring blocks. Bordering blocks having less than eight neighbours will result in alternative indices.
        Parameters:
        k - the index of the current block
        Returns:
        Array containing the indices

        ij.process.ByteProcessor generateMVFPerSlice(int slice)
